Description: Footed bowl: of transparent dark-blue glass, an unusual colour for this date. The circular rim is folded out. The body tapers in two convex curves to the low cylindrical stem. The wide circular base, slightly concave, has the usual' straw marks' or impressions from criss-cross tooling. Blown. Complete. Body cracked on one side.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: ‘Masterpieces of Glass, The British Museum’ (London 1968), no. 107.
